abstract: Michael Graves, prominent and prolific 20th century American architect who was also celebrated for his teakettle and pepper mill, dies at age 80; he began as member of the New York Five, group that achieved fame by helping to redefine modernism in the 1970s, and later became an exemplar of postmodernist style, creating some 350 buildings and many houseware designs.
lead_paragraph: Mr. Graves, one of the most prominent and prolific American architects of the latter 20th century, was perhaps best known for his teakettle and pepper mill.

headline.main: Michael Graves, 80, Dies; Postmodernist Designed Towers and Teakettles
headline.print_headline: Michael Graves, Who Put Big Ideas Into Small Items, Dies at 80

snippet: Mr. Graves, one of the most prominent and prolific American architects of the latter 20th century, was perhaps best known for his teakettle and pepper mill.
